titles.title: A bill for the relief of James P. Purvis.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.
Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice. Subcommittee approved for full committee consideration.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Byrd for Senator Biden without amendment. With written report No. 100-298.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 584.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
House Committee on The Judiciary Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 8/6/1987--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay a specified sum to a named individual in full satisfaction of any claim of that individual and a named company against the United States arising out of a contract with the United States for construction of a building at the World's Fair in Seattle, Washington, in 1962.
